dcterms:description: A dataset containing real-time data for macroeconomic and financial variables, used for recession forecasting.
dcterms:title: Real-time data for macroeconomic and financial variables

dcterms:description: A dataset containing business cycle dates identified by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER), used to define recession periods.
dcterms:title: NBER business cycle dates

dcterms:creator: M. Chauvet
J. Piger
dcterms:description: Variables used by Chauvet and Piger (2008) to identify business cycle dates in real time.
dcterms:title: Variables used by Chauvet and Piger (2008) to identify business cycle dates

dcterms:creator: W. Mitchell
A. Burns
dcterms:description: Economic indicators for business cycles identified by Mitchell and Burns (1938), used as potential indicators for recession forecasting.
dcterms:title: Economic indicators for business cycles identified by Mitchell and Burns (1938)

dcterms:creator: A. Estrella
F. Mishkin
dcterms:description: Variables used in the study by Estrella and Mishkin (1996) to predict U.S. recessions.
dcterms:title: Variables used in the study by Estrella and Mishkin (1996)

dcterms:creator: M. Puglia
A. Tucker
dcterms:description: Variables used in the study by Puglia and Tucker (2021) for recession forecasting.
dcterms:title: Variables used in the study by Puglia and Tucker (2021)

dcterms:creator: P. Delgado
E. Congregado
A. Golpe
J. Vides
dcterms:description: Variables used in the study by Delgado et al. (2022) to analyze the yield curve as a recession leading indicator.
dcterms:title: Variables used in the study by Delgado et al. (2022)
